document.masterDocTitle: New record of Agrisius Walker (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae) from Cambodia with description of a new species

bibRefCitation.refString: Moore, F. (1872) Descriptions of new Indian Lepidoptera. Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London, 1872, 555 - 583, pls. XXXII-XXXIV.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Agrisius fuliginosus Moore, 1872
, Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London 1872 (2): 571, pl. 33, f. 3. TL: “ India ”.

Diagnosis. Length of the forewing 20–26 mm in male, 25–29 mm in female.
Agrisius fuliginosus Moore
differs from other members of
fuliginosus
species–group by having the apex of valva more rounded, and distal end of aedeagus with one small spine and vesica without cornuti in male genitalia ( Dubatolov & Kishida 2013: 158 , fig. 5; present paper: figs. 5a–b specimen of Laos , 6a–b specimen of Myanmar ); in female genitalia ( Orhant 1997: 34 , figs. 3, 6; present paper: figs. 8a–b specimen of Myanmar ), ostial plate strongly sclerotized, weakly M–shaped; antrum strongly sclerotized, irregularly triangle; ductus bursae strongly sclerotized in 1/5 from antrum.

Distribution. India , Nepal , N Myanmar , NW China ( Yunnan ), N Thailand , Laos and N Vietnam .

Remarks. This species is recorded here in Myanmar ( Kachin State ), China ( Yunnan Province ), Thailand ( Chiang Mai , Lampang , Nan and Phayao Provinces), Laos (XiengKhouang, Luang Prabang , Luang Namtha and Oudomxai Provinces) and Vietnam ( Lào Cai , Hòa Bình and Ninh Bình Provinces) for the first time.
